page.title: 01Sheerness Isle of Sheppey
page.content: The block under review consists of seven one kilometre squares of{sea}and of the remainder only one is totally land. The small proportion of{low {lying land}divides into two main categories, residential and rough grazing. The residential area is part of the town centre of Sheerness on the Isle of Sheppey which is linked to the mainland of Kent by the Kingsferry Bridge. Sheerness is situated to the north west of the island on the estuary of the River Thames. The grazing land is now used for recreational purposes. From east to west there is a change from land covered by older{housing,}to land in part used for{caravans and {chalets}and leisure pursuits, to higher ground occupied by more recent developments.
